title: Definitions
context: [ยง440J-1] Definitions. As used in this chapter, unless the context otherwise requires: &ldquo;Broadband access or broadband service&rdquo; means an &ldquo;always-on&rdquo; service that includes but is not limited to computer processing capabilities, information provision, and computing interactivity with data transport, enabling end users to access the Internet and use a variety of applications at minimum speeds established by the Federal Communications Commission. &ldquo;Broadband infrastructure&rdquo; means the medium used to provide broadband access or broadband service, including fiber optic cable, copper cable, coaxial cable, and wireless media, such as satellite communications, wi-fi, and worldwide interoperability for microwave access. &ldquo;Broadband speed threshold&rdquo; means the highest speed threshold defined or established in the most recent broadband progress report issued by the Federal Communications Commission to Congress. &ldquo;Department&rdquo; means the department of commerce and consumer affairs. &ldquo;Director&rdquo; means the director of commerce and consumer affairs. &ldquo;Mapping information&rdquo; means the information required under the United States Department of Commerce&rsquo;s National Telecommunications and Information Administration broadband data and development grant, number 15-50-M09057. &ldquo;Provider&rdquo; means any cable operator, telecommunications carrier, or telecommunications common carrier that provides broadband service. [L 2012, c 259, pt of ยง2]
